About This Game

RAGE is a groundbreaking first-person shooter set in the not-too-distant future after an asteroid impacts Earth, leaving a ravaged world behind. You emerge into this vast wasteland to discover humanity working to rebuild itself against such forces as bandit gangs, mutants, and the Authority – an oppressive government regime that has a special interest in you in particular. Featuring intense first-person shooter action, breakneck vehicle combat, an expansive world to explore and jaw-dropping graphics powered by id’s revolutionary id Tech® 5 technology, RAGE promises an experience like no other.
Fearing a planet-wide extinction from a massive asteroid headed towards Earth, world leaders are faced with the inexorable task of ensuring human survival. Left with few alternatives, life-sustaining pods filled with select people are buried deep beneath the earth’s surface. You are one of the chosen members of these modern day arks and abruptly enter the RAGE universe after surfacing alone. Leaving you to your own devices to stay alive in a world filled with those who prefer you dead, RAGE combines powerful storytelling with heart-pounding action.

Key Features:

  • Visceral 1st-person gunplay and exploration – Take on bandit gangs and hordes of mutants using an arsenal of exotic weapons and special items, such as Wingsticks, personal turrets, sentry bots, and remote-controlled bomb cars.
  • Frenetic 3rd-person vehicular mayhem – Burn rubber across the wasteland in your very own super buggy! Upgrade and customize your car with special parts, paint jobs and weapons, then test your skills as you battle four-wheeling bandit clans and participate in deadly races.
  • An expansive experience – Beyond the first-person action and vehicle combat, RAGE offers a world open to explore, with unique characters, side quests, and a compelling storyline.
  • Graphics that have to be seen to be believed – Powered by id’s cutting-edge new id Tech® 5 engine, new Megatexture technology brings the vast wasteland to life in never-before- possible detail with action running at an astounding 60 frames per second.
  • Three ways to play for non-stop action - Immerse yourself in a rich single-player story, exclusive co-op modes, or intense on-line car combat.
READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Win XP SP3, Vista, Win 7
    • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo or Equivalent AMD
    • Memory: 2GB
    • Hard Disk Space: 25GB
    • Video Card: GeForce 8800, Radeon HD 4200
    Recommended:
    • OS: Win XP SP3, Vista, Win 7
    • Processor: Intel Core 2 Quad or Equivalent AMD
    • Memory: 4GB
    • Hard Disk Space: 25GB
    • Video Card: GeForce 9800 GTX, Radeon HD 5550

Solo4114
237 products in account
14 reviews
Not Recommended
28.4 hrs on record
Posted: July 20
I wish Steam had a "Meh" rating, because that's how I felt about Rage. Not a solid "No" but definitely not a "Yes."

RAGE is, let's be clear, an old-school shooter. In spite of slightly open visuals, most of your FPS action occurs in the same general tunnels and limited pathways that Id Software has been doing since Wolfenstein 3D. Oh, and there's a driving/racing component which is decidedly "meh."

The IdTech 5 engine is visually reasonably pretty, but the game is, I gather, pretty poorly optimized to take full advantage of the highest resolution textures. But to be honest, I don't find the graphics all that amazing, and graphics alone don't sway me without otherwise solid gameplay.

The story itself is pretty humdrum stuff, and ends rather abruptly. I gather we won't be seeing a sequel, at least not any time soon, since Id is busy with Doom 4. Honestly, it's nothing special. Post-apocalyptic wasteland controlled by authoritarian regime (very cleverly known as "The Authority." Yeah.). Plucky rebel faction fights against them and sees you as their possible savior because...aw hell, I forget why. But whatever. You're the chosen one.

You fight alone through Id corridors using mostly typical weapons (pistol, shotgun, assault rifle, sniper rifle, etc.). There's some variation there, but it's all the usual suspects. The gunplay itself is kind of meh, really. I found the sound design for the weapons to generally be kind of underwhelming. They seem to "clatter" rather than "boom," if that makes sense. The wingstick is kinda neat, but limited in ammo.

The minigames are generally pretty forgettable. Gambling stuff, racing, and rhythm games, really. Nothing special.

Honestly, the game plays like an "also ran" to Borderlands, but it takes itself much more seriously and lacks any co-op component. I'd say it's worth not more than $5. At that rate, it's decently fun to run around and shoot stuff. But it's a fairly disposable game and even at a $5 price tag, you won't be missing much if you skip it.
Read More
 
Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny

1
~Zero
1,362 products in account
64 reviews
Recommended
41.5 hrs on record
Posted: July 20
A semi-open world semi-linear FPS game. You are a survivor of a post-apocalyptic world, battling bandits and mutants at first until you are dragged into a resistance in war with a corrupted army of battle armor soldiers.

This game have one linear main quest, and a number of side quests per main event. Each main quest involve you traversing an area like a city, a dungeon, or a tunnel to find something or kill everyone. Backtracking/sidetracking options are very limited, so there is no feeling of repetition at all.

Weapon options are padded very nicely. The variety are there and not too overwhelming. Your guns are upgraded progressively, and each have their own pro and cons. Your most basic guns are still very useful near the end of the game when you have access to upgraded ammos. The crafting system is there, but I find myself only crafting a few items and ignore all the rest. The sentry bots are kinda OP though, they are very useful in a fight and their ingredients are cheap and common.

There are plenty of mini-games to explore during your main-quest downtime. There's a racing game that is actually pretty good! And there's a collectible card game where the cards are part of the game's collectible items scattered throughout the world. There's an arena for you to kill mutants for money when you just want to kill stuff.

Although it is considered an old release now, you will still need a powerful rig to run this game. The graphics are very good even when compared to today's standard. The gameplay itself is good, but the menu controls feels like a bad console port, mouse sensitivity is very inconsistent.

For achievement hunters
The Scorchers DLC is needed for 100% completion. Minimum 2 playthroughs are recommended if you want to collect all the achievements. Single player achievements are all quite doable, and all of the missable achievements are no longer missable after years of patches. Except a few will require some luck and patience if you aren't very good in that mini-game. Multiplayer is dead, 3-player boosting is needed for 100% completion. Also, 2-player coop buddy will be needed for the coop campaign.

The ending is kinda disappointing.
Other than that, this is a very good game.

My score: 9/10

I got this game with the hopes that it's like Fallout, but with more action and less talking ... I received exactly what I was asking for. If you aren't in the mood for story and immersion, but just brutal and very satisfying action, then this game is for you.
I love all post apocalyptic art.

mountveggie
309 products in account
10 reviews
Recommended
25.2 hrs on record
Posted: June 12
Rage is the perfect example of how a bad launch can irreversibly ruin a game. When the game was first released in 2011, the "mega textures" looked great - when it worked. Most of the time, it didn't. That ruined the game for me, and apparently many others as well.

Fast forward to 2015. With all the problems patched, Rage runs perfectly. Plus, it looks gorgeous - even by today's standards. In fact, I'd dare say Rage is the best looking FPS game in my opinion (even though The Order: 1886 and Battlefield have more amazing tech, Rage has incredible artistic direction).

Pros
- Great selection of guns
- Guns feel real, weighty and powerful
- Incredibly interesting cast of characters
- Interesting, varied and intelligent/believable enemies
- Amazing graphics, even by 2015 standards
- Great level design with varied levels
- Fun distrations around town (i.e. the game's hub area), including a surprisingly addictive card game
- Good range of difficulty levels
- DLC that's actually worth the price!

Cons
- Given the intersting array of characters, the story really doesn't live up to its potential
- WAY too few boss battles
- NO RAGE 2!! (Ok this isn't really a con, but we need a Rage 2!)

In summary, this is one of the finest FPS games ever made. There isn't an epic story to be told, but if you love to shoot stuff - this is as good as it gets. Old school gunplay (without any modern "gun carrying limit" BS) with new school gameplay variety and graphics.

Rage is a steal even at full price. If you're a fan of FPS games (or even if you're not), this is one game that needs to be in your collection.
